citation: Beck, A. T., Ward, C. H., Mendelson, M., Mock, J., & Erbaugh, J. (1961). An inventory for measuring depression. Archives of General Psychiatry, 4(6), 561-571.
license: Original 1961 version is in the public domain (BDI-II 1996 is copyrighted by Pearson)
note: Each BDI item is a graded set of 4 statements (0-3). Here we include the highest-severity statement per item as the representative text, mapped to atlas BDI factors.

items.text: I am so sad and unhappy that I can't stand it
I feel the future is hopeless and that things cannot improve
I feel I am a complete failure as a person
I am dissatisfied or bored with everything
I feel guilty all of the time
I feel I am being punished
I am disgusted with myself
I blame myself for everything bad that happens
I would kill myself if I had the chance
I cry all the time now
I am so restless or agitated that I have to keep moving or doing something
I have lost all of my interest in other people
I can't make decisions at all anymore
I believe that I look ugly
I can't do any work at all
I wake up several hours earlier than I used to and cannot get back to sleep
I am too tired to do anything
I have no appetite at all anymore
I have lost more than fifteen pounds
I am so worried about my physical problems that I cannot think about anything else
I have lost interest in sex completely
